items.Name: Master Ball
items.Description: The best Poké Ball with the ultimate level of performance. With it, you will catch any wild Pokémon without fail.

items.Name: Ultra Ball
items.Description: An ultra-high performance Poké Ball that provides a higher success rate for catching Pokémon than a Great Ball.

items.Name: Great Ball
items.Description: A good, high-performance Poké Ball that provides a higher Pokémon catch rate than a standard Poké Ball can.

items.Name: Poké Ball
items.Description: A device for catching wild Pokémon. It's thrown like a ball at a Pokémon, comfortably encapsulating its target.

items.Name: Safari Ball
items.Description: A special Poké Ball that is used only in the Great Marsh. It is recognizable by the camouflage pattern decorating it.

items.Name: Net Ball
items.Description: A somewhat different Poké Ball that is more effective when attempting to catch Water- or Bug-type Pokémon.

items.Name: Dive Ball
items.Description: A somewhat different Poké Ball that works especially well when catching Pokémon that live underwater.

items.Name: Nest Ball
items.Description: A somewhat different Poké Ball that becomes more effective the lower the level of the wild Pokémon.

items.Name: Repeat Ball
items.Description: A somewhat different Poké Ball that works especially well on Pokémon species that have been caught before.

items.Name: Timer Ball
items.Description: A somewhat different Poké Ball that becomes progressively more effective the more turns that are taken in battle.

items.Name: Luxury Ball
items.Description: A particularly comfortable Poké Ball that makes a wild Pokémon quickly grow friendlier after being caught.

items.Name: Premier Ball
items.Description: A somewhat rare Poké Ball that was made as a commemorative item used to celebrate an event of some sort.

items.Name: Dusk Ball
items.Description: A somewhat different Poké Ball that makes it easier to catch wild Pokémon at night or in dark places like caves.

items.Name: Heal Ball
items.Description: A remedial Poké Ball that restores the HP of a Pokémon caught with it and eliminates any status conditions.

items.Name: Quick Ball
items.Description: A somewhat different Poké Ball that has a more successful catch rate if used at the start of a wild encounter.

items.Name: Cherish Ball
items.Description: A quite rare Poké Ball that has been crafted in order to commemorate a special occasion of some sort.

items.Name: Potion
items.Description: A spray-type medicine for treating wounds. It can be used to restore 20 HP to an injured Pokémon.

items.Name: Antidote
items.Description: A spray-type medicine for poisoning. It can be used once to lift the effects of being poisoned from a Pokémon.

items.Name: Burn Heal
items.Description: A spray-type medicine for treating burns. It can be used once to heal a Pokemon suffering from a burn.

items.Name: Ice Heal
items.Description: A spray-type medicine for freezing. It can be used once to defrost a Pokémon that has been frozen solid.

items.Name: Awakening
items.Description: A spray-type medicine used against sleep. It can be used once to rouse a Pokémon from the clutches of sleep.

items.Name: Paralyze Heal
items.Description: A spray-type medicine for paralysis. It can be used once to free a Pokémon that has been paralyzed.

items.Name: Full Restore
items.Description: A medicine that can be used to fully restore the HP of a single Pokémon and heal any status conditions it has.

items.Name: Max Potion
items.Description: A spray-type medicine for treating wounds. It will completely restore the max HP of a single Pokémon.

items.Name: Hyper Potion
items.Description: A spray-type medicine for treating wounds. It can be used to restore 120 HP to an injured Pokémon.

items.Name: Super Potion
items.Description: A spray-type medicine for treating wounds. It can be used to restore 60 HP to an injured Pokémon.

items.Name: Full Heal
items.Description: A spray-type medicine that is broadly effective. It can be used once to heal all the status conditions of a Pokémon.

items.Name: Revive
items.Description: A medicine that can revive fainted Pokémon. It also restores half of a fainted Pokémon's maximum HP.

items.Name: Max Revive
items.Description: A medicine that can revive fainted Pokémon. It also fully restores a fainted Pokémon's maximum HP.

items.Name: Fresh Water
items.Description: Water with a high mineral content. When consumed, it restores 30 HP to an injured Pokémon.

items.Name: Soda Pop
items.Description: A highly carbonated soda drink. When consumed, it restores 50 HP to an injured Pokémon.

items.Name: Lemonade
items.Description: A very sweet and refreshing drink. When consumed, it restores 70 HP to an injured Pokémon.

items.Name: Moomoo Milk
items.Description: A bottle of highly nutritious milk. When consumed, it restores 100 HP to an injured Pokémon.

items.Name: Energy Powder
items.Description: A bitter medicine powder. When consumed, it restores 60 HP to an injured Pokémon.

items.Name: Energy Root
items.Description: An extremely bitter medicinal root. When consumed, it restores 120 HP to an injured Pokémon.

items.Name: Heal Powder
items.Description: A very bitter medicine powder. When consumed, it heals all of a Pokémon's status conditions.

items.Name: Revival Herb
items.Description: A terribly bitter medicinal herb. It revives a fainted Pokémon and fully restores its maximum HP.

items.Name: Ether
items.Description: This medicine can restore 10 PP to a single selected move that has been learned by a Pokémon.

items.Name: Max Ether
items.Description: This medicine can fully restore the PP of a single selected move that has been learned by a Pokémon.

items.Name: Elixir
items.Description: This medicine can restore 10 PP to each of the moves that have been learned by a Pokémon.

items.Name: Max Elixir
items.Description: This medicine can fully restore the PP of all of the moves that have been learned by a Pokémon.

items.Name: Lava Cookie
items.Description: Lavaridge Town's local specialty. It can be used once to heal all the status conditions of a Pokémon.

items.Name: Berry Juice
items.Description: A 100 percent pure juice made of Berries. When consumed, it restores 20 HP to an injured Pokémon.

items.Name: Sacred Ash
items.Description: This rare ash can revive all fainted Pokémon in a party. In doing so, it also fully restores their maximum HP.

items.Name: HP Up
items.Description: A nutritious drink for Pokémon. When consumed, it raises the base HP of a single Pokémon.

items.Name: Protein
items.Description: A nutritious drink for Pokémon. When consumed, it raises the base Attack stat of a single Pokémon.

items.Name: Iron
items.Description: A nutritious drink for Pokémon. When consumed, it raises the base Defense stat of a single Pokémon.

items.Name: Carbos
items.Description: A nutritious drink for Pokémon. When consumed, it raises the base Speed stat of a single Pokémon.

items.Name: Calcium
items.Description: A nutritious drink for Pokémon. When consumed, it raises the base Sp. Atk stat of a single Pokémon.

items.Name: Rare Candy
items.Description: A candy that is packed with energy. When consumed, it will instantly raise the level of a single Pokémon by one.

items.Name: PP Up
items.Description: A medicine that can slightly raise the maximum PP of a single move that has been learned by the target Pokémon.

items.Name: Zinc
items.Description: A nutritious drink for Pokémon. When consumed, it raises the base Sp. Def stat of a single Pokémon.

items.Name: PP Max
items.Description: A medicine that can optimally raise the maximum PP of a single move that has been learned by the target Pokémon.

items.Name: Old Gateau
items.Description: The Old Chateau's hidden specialty. It can be used once to heal all the status conditions of a Pokémon.

items.Name: Guard Spec.
items.Description: An item that prevents stat reduction among the Trainer's party Pokémon for five turns after it is used in battle.

items.Name: Dire Hit
items.Description: An item that raises the critical-hit ratio greatly. It can be used only once and wears off if the Pokémon is withdrawn.

items.Name: X Attack
items.Description: An item that boosts the Attack stat of a Pokémon during a battle. It wears off once the Pokémon is withdrawn.

items.Name: X Defense
items.Description: An item that boosts the Defense stat of a Pokémon during a battle. It wears off once the Pokémon is withdrawn.

items.Name: X Speed
items.Description: An item that boosts the Speed stat of a Pokémon during a battle. It wears off once the Pokémon is withdrawn.

items.Name: X Accuracy
items.Description: An item that boosts the accuracy of a Pokémon during a battle. It wears off once the Pokémon is withdrawn.

items.Name: X Sp. Atk
items.Description: An item that boosts the Sp. Atk stat of a Pokémon during a battle. It wears off once the Pokémon is withdrawn.

items.Name: X Sp. Def
items.Description: An item that boosts the Sp. Def stat of a Pokémon during a battle. It wears off once the Pokémon is withdrawn.

items.Name: Poké Doll
items.Description: A doll that attracts the attention of a Pokémon. It guarantees escape from any battle with wild Pokémon.

items.Name: Fluffy Tail
items.Description: A toy that attracts the attention of a Pokémon. It guarantees escape from any battle with wild Pokémon.

items.Name: Blue Flute
items.Description: A flute made from blue glass that awakens sleeping Pokémon.

items.Name: Yellow Flute
items.Description: A flute made from yellow glass that snaps Pokémon out of confusion.

items.Name: Red Flute
items.Description: A flute made from red glass that snaps Pokémon out of infatuation.

items.Name: Black Flute
items.Description: A flute made from black glass. It makes it easier to encounter strong Pokémon in the place you use it.

items.Name: White Flute
items.Description: A flute made from white glass. It makes it easier to encounter weak Pokémon in the place you use it.

items.Name: Shoal Salt
items.Description: Salt that you found inside Shoal Cave.

items.Name: Shoal Shell
items.Description: A seashell that you found inside Shoal Cave.

items.Name: Red Shard
items.Description: A small red shard. It appears to be a fragment of some sort of implement made long ago.

items.Name: Blue Shard
items.Description: A small blue shard. It appears to be a fragment of some sort of implement made long ago.

items.Name: Yellow Shard
items.Description: A small yellow shard. It appears to be a fragment of some sort of implement made long ago.

items.Name: Green Shard
items.Description: A small green shard. It appears to be a fragment of some sort of implement made long ago.

items.Name: Super Repel
items.Description: An item that prevents any low-level wild Pokémon from jumping out at you for 200 steps after its use.

items.Name: Max Repel
items.Description: An item that prevents any low-level wild Pokémon from jumping out at you for 250 steps after its use.

items.Name: Escape Rope
items.Description: A long and durable rope. Use it to escape instantly from a cave or a dungeon.

items.Name: Repel
items.Description: An item that prevents any low-level wild Pokémon from jumping out at you for 100 steps after its use.

items.Name: Sun Stone
items.Description: A peculiar stone that can make certain species of Pokémon evolve. It burns as red as the evening sun.

items.Name: Moon Stone
items.Description: A peculiar stone that can make certain species of Pokémon evolve. It is as black as the night sky.

items.Name: Fire Stone
items.Description: A peculiar stone that can make certain species of Pokémon evolve. The stone has a fiery orange heart.

items.Name: Thunder Stone
items.Description: A peculiar stone that can make certain species of Pokémon evolve. It has a distinct thunderbolt pattern.

items.Name: Water Stone
items.Description: A peculiar stone that can make certain species of Pokémon evolve. It is the blue of a pool of clear water.

items.Name: Leaf Stone
items.Description: A peculiar stone that can make certain species of Pokémon evolve. It has an unmistakable leaf pattern.

items.Name: Tiny Mushroom
items.Description: A very small and rare mushroom. It's popular with a certain class of collectors and sought out by them.

items.Name: Big Mushroom
items.Description: A very large and rare mushroom. It's popular with a certain class of collectors and sought out by them.

items.Name: Pearl
items.Description: A rather small pearl that has a very nice silvery sheen to it. It can be sold cheaply to shops.

items.Name: Big Pearl
items.Description: A rather large pearl that has a very nice silvery sheen. It can be sold to shops for a high price.

items.Name: Stardust
items.Description: Lovely, red sand that flows between the fingers with a loose, silky feel. It can be sold at a high price to shops.

items.Name: Star Piece
items.Description: A small shard of a beautiful gem that demonstrates a distinctly red sparkle. It can be sold at a high price to shops.

items.Name: Nugget
items.Description: A nugget of the purest gold that gives off a lustrous gleam in direct light. It can be sold at a high price to shops.

items.Name: Heart Scale
items.Description: A pretty, heart-shaped scale that is extremely rare. It glows faintly with all of the colors of the rainbow.

items.Name: Honey
items.Description: A sweet honey with a lush aroma that attracts wild Pokémon when it is used in tall grass, in caves, or on special trees.

items.Name: Growth Mulch
items.Description: A fertilizer for growing Berries. However, it appears to be unsuitable for the soil in the Hoenn region and has no effect.

items.Name: Damp Mulch
items.Description: A fertilizer for growing Berries. However, it appears to be unsuitable for the soil in the Hoenn region and has no effect.

items.Name: Stable Mulch
items.Description: A fertilizer for growing Berries. However, it appears to be unsuitable for the soil in the Hoenn region and has no effect.

items.Name: Gooey Mulch
items.Description: A fertilizer for growing Berries. However, it appears to be unsuitable for the soil in the Hoenn region and has no effect.

items.Name: Root Fossil
items.Description: A fossil from a prehistoric Pokémon that once lived in the sea. It looks as if it could be part of a plant's root.

items.Name: Claw Fossil
items.Description: A fossil from a prehistoric Pokémon that once lived in the sea. It appears to be a fragment of a claw.

items.Name: Helix Fossil
items.Description: A fossil from a prehistoric Pokémon that once lived in the sea. It could be a shell or carapace.

items.Name: Dome Fossil
items.Description: A fossil from a prehistoric Pokémon that once lived in the sea. It might be a piece of a seashell.

items.Name: Old Amber
items.Description: A piece of amber that still contains the genetic material of an ancient Pokémon. It's clear with a tawny, reddish tint.

items.Name: Armor Fossil
items.Description: A fossil from a prehistoric Pokémon that once lived on the land. It looks to be from some kind of protective collar.

items.Name: Skull Fossil
items.Description: A fossil from a prehistoric Pokémon that once lived on the land. It appears as though it's part of a head.

items.Name: Rare Bone
items.Description: A rare bone that is extremely valuable for the study of Pokémon archeology. It can be sold for a high price to shops.

items.Name: Shiny Stone
items.Description: A peculiar stone that can make certain species of Pokémon evolve. It shines with a dazzling light.

items.Name: Dusk Stone
items.Description: A peculiar stone that can make certain species of Pokémon evolve. It holds shadows as dark as can be.

items.Name: Dawn Stone
items.Description: A peculiar stone that can make certain species of Pokémon evolve. It sparkles like a glittering eye.

items.Name: Oval Stone
items.Description: A peculiar stone that can make certain species of Pokémon evolve. It's as round as a Pokémon Egg.

items.Name: Odd Keystone
items.Description: A vital item that is needed to keep a stone tower from collapsing. Voices can be heard from it occasionally.

items.Name: Griseous Orb
items.Description: A glowing orb to be held by Giratina. It boosts the power of Dragon- and Ghost-type moves when it is held.

items.Name: Douse Drive
items.Description: A cassette to be held by Genesect. It changes Genesect's Techno Blast move so it becomes Water type.

items.Name: Shock Drive
items.Description: A cassette to be held by Genesect. It changes Genesect's Techno Blast move so it becomes Electric type.

items.Name: Burn Drive
items.Description: A cassette to be held by Genesect. It changes Genesect's Techno Blast move so it becomes Fire type.

items.Name: Chill Drive
items.Description: A cassette to be held by Genesect. It changes Genesect's Techno Blast move so it becomes Ice type.

items.Name: Sweet Heart
items.Description: A piece of cloyingly sweet chocolate. When consumed, it restores 20 HP to an injured Pokémon.

items.Name: Adamant Orb
items.Description: A brightly gleaming orb to be held by Dialga. It boosts the power of Dragon- and Steel-type moves when it is held.

items.Name: Lustrous Orb
items.Description: A beautifully glowing orb to be held by Palkia. It boosts the power of Dragon- and Water-type moves when it is held.

items.Name: Greet Mail
items.Description: Stationery designed to be easy to use when writing someone for the first time. Have a Pokémon hold it for delivery.

items.Name: Favored Mail
items.Description: Stationery designed to be easy to use when writing someone for the first time. Have a Pokémon hold it for delivery.

items.Name: RSVP Mail
items.Description: Stationery designed to allow you to extend an invitation to the recipient. Have a Pokémon hold it for delivery.

items.Name: Thanks Mail
items.Description: Stationery designed to make it easy to express your thanks. Have a Pokémon hold it for delivery.

items.Name: Inquiry Mail
items.Description: Stationery designed to make it easier to write to pose a question about something. Have a Pokémon hold it for delivery.

items.Name: Like Mail
items.Description: Stationery designed to allow you to reccomend something to the reader. Have a Pokémon hold it for delivery.

items.Name: Reply Mail
items.Description: Stationery designed to make it easy to respond to a letter you receieved. Have a Pokémon hold it for delivery.

items.Name: Bridge Mail S
items.Description: Stationery featuring an illustration of a bridge that seems to pierce the sky. Have a Pokémon hold it for delivery.

items.Name: Bridge Mail D
items.Description: Stationery featuring an illustration bright-red drawbridge. Have a Pokémon hold it for delivery.

items.Name: Bridge Mail T
items.Description: Stationery featuring an illustration high-tension steel suspension bridge. Have a Pokémon hold it for delivery.

items.Name: Bridge Mail V
items.Description: Stationery featuring an illustration of a vintage looking brick bridge. Have a Pokémon hold it for delivery.

items.Name: Bridge Mail M
items.Description: Stationery featuring an illustration of a majesticly arched bridge. Have a Pokémon hold it for delivery.
