This is a crystallized form of Z-Power. It upgrades Snorlax's Giga Impact to a Z-Move.

items.Name: Eevium Z
items.Description:
It converts Z-Power into crystals that upgrade Eevee's Last Resort to an exclusive Z-Move.
This is a crystallized form of Z-Power. It upgrades Eevee's Last Resort to a Z-Move.

items.Name: Mewnium Z
items.Description:
It converts Z-Power into crystals that upgrade Mew's Psychic to an exclusive Z-Move.
This is a crystallized form of Z-Power. It upgrades Mew's Psychic to a Z-Move.

items.Name: Pikashunium Z
items.Description:
It converts Z-Power into crystals that upgrade a Thunderbolt by Pikachu in a cap to an exclusive Z-Move.
This is a crystallized form of Z-Power. It upgrades a Thunderbolt by Pikachu in a cap to a Z-Move.

items.Name: Pikashunium Z
items.Description:
It converts Z-Power into crystals that upgrade a Thunderbolt by Pikachu in a cap to an exclusive Z-Move.
This is a crystallized form of Z-Power. It upgrades a Thunderbolt by Pikachu in a cap to a Z-Move.

items.Name: Forage Bag
items.Description: A bag to carry ingredients gathered during Mallow's trial in the jungle.

items.Name: Fishing Rod
items.Description: A Fishing Rod made by Captain Lana. Cast a line over piles of underwater rocks to fish for wild aquatic Pokémon.

items.Name: Professor's Mask
items.Description: The mask that belongs to The Masked Royal. This pro wrestler apparently sews his mask on a machine himself.

items.Name: Festival Ticket
items.Description: A ticket that allows you to host a mission in Festival Plaza.

items.Name: Sparkling Stone
items.Description: A stone entrusted by a Pokémon that has been venerated as a guardian deity in the Alola region. There is said to be some secret in how it sparkles.

items.Name: Adrenaline Orb
items.Description: Using it makes wild Pokémon more likely to call for help. If held by a Pokémon, it boosts Speed when intimidated. It can be used only once.

items.Name: Zygarde Cube
items.Description: An item to store Zygarde Cores and Cells. You can also use it to teach Zygarde moves.

items.Name: Ice Stone
items.Description: A peculiar stone that can make certain species of Pokémon evolve. It has an unmistakable snowflake pattern.

items.Name: Ride Pager
items.Description: By entering certain numbers on this pager, you can summon Ride Pokémon in an instant.

items.Name: Beast Ball
items.Description: A special Poké Ball designed to catch Ultra Beasts. It has a low success rate for catching others.

items.Name: Big Malasada
items.Description: The Alola region's local specialty-fried bread. It can be used once to heal all the status conditions of a Pokémon.

items.Name: Red Nectar
items.Description: A flower nectar obtained at Ula'ula Meadow. It changes the form of certain species of Pokémon.

items.Name: Yellow Nectar
items.Description: A flower nectar obtained at Melemele Meadow. It changes the form of certain species of Pokémon.

items.Name: Pink Nectar
items.Description: The flower nectar obtained at the flowering shrubs on Royal Avenue. It changes the form of certain species of Pokémon.

items.Name: Purple Nectar
items.Description: A flower nectar obtained at Poni Meadow. It changes the form of certain species of Pokémon.

items.Name: Sun Flute
items.Description: It is said that the tones it produces were offered up as an expression of gratitude to the Legendary Pokémon of the sun.

items.Name: Moon Flute
items.Description: It is said that the tones it produces were offered up as an expression of gratitude to the Legendary Pokémon of the moon.

items.Name: Enigmatic Card
items.Description: A mysterious card. Written on it is a request for you to go to a guest room in an Akala motel on Route 8.

items.Name: Terrain Extender
items.Description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It extends the duration of the terrain caused by the holder's move or Ability.

items.Name: Protective Pads
items.Description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. These pads protect the holder from effects caused by making direct contact with the target.

items.Name: Electric Seed
items.Description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It boosts Defense on Electric Terrain. It can only be used once.

items.Name: Psychic Seed
items.Description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It boosts Sp. Defense on Psychic Terrain. It can only be used once.

items.Name: Misty Seed
items.Description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It boosts Sp. Defense on Misty Terrain. It can only be used once.

items.Name: Grassy Seed
items.Description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It boosts Defense on Grassy Terrain. It can only be used once.

items.Name: Fighting Memory
items.Description: A memory disc that contains Fighting-type data. It changes the type of the holder if held by a certain species of Pokémon.

items.Name: Flying Memory
items.Description: A memory disc that contains Flying-type data. It changes the type of the holder if held by a certain species of Pokémon.

items.Name: Poison Memory
items.Description: A memory disc that contains Poison-type data. It changes the type of the holder if held by a certain species of Pokémon.

items.Name: Ground Memory
items.Description: A memory disc that contains Ground-type data. It changes the type of the holder if held by a certain species of Pokémon.

items.Name: Rock Memory
items.Description: A memory disc that contains Rock-type data. It changes the type of the holder if held by a certain species of Pokémon.

items.Name: Bug Memory
items.Description: A memory disc that contains Bug-type data. It changes the type of the holder if held by a certain species of Pokémon.

items.Name: Ghost Memory
items.Description: A memory disc that contains Ghost-type data. It changes the type of the holder if held by a certain species of Pokémon.

items.Name: Steel Memory
items.Description: A memory disc that contains Steel-type data. It changes the type of the holder if held by a certain species of Pokémon.

items.Name: Fire Memory
items.Description: A memory disc that contains Fire-type data. It changes the type of the holder if held by a certain species of Pokémon.

items.Name: Water Memory
items.Description: A memory disc that contains Water-type data. It changes the type of the holder if held by a certain species of Pokémon.

items.Name: Grass Memory
items.Description: A memory disc that contains Grass-type data. It changes the type of the holder if held by a certain species of Pokémon.

items.Name: Electric Memory
items.Description: A memory disc that contains Electric-type data. It changes the type of the holder if held by a certain species of Pokémon.

items.Name: Psychic Memory
items.Description: A memory disc that contains Psychic-type data. It changes the type of the holder if held by a certain species of Pokémon.

items.Name: Ice Memory
items.Description: A memory disc that contains Ice-type data. It changes the type of the holder if held by a certain species of Pokémon.

items.Name: Dragon Memory
items.Description: A memory disc that contains Dragon-type data. It changes the type of the holder if held by a certain species of Pokémon.

items.Name: Dark Memory
items.Description: A memory disc that contains Dark-type data. It changes the type of the holder if held by a certain species of Pokémon.

items.Name: Fairy Memory
items.Description: A memory disc that contains Fairy-type data. It changes the type of the holder if held by a certain species of Pokémon.

items.Name: HM08
items.Description: Teaches Rock Climb to a compatible Pokémon. The user attacks the target by smashing into it with incredible force. This may also confuse the target.

items.Name: HM09
items.Description: Teaches Flash to a compatible Pokémon. The user flashes a bright light that cuts the target's accuracy.

items.Name: HM10
items.Description: Teaches Defog to a compatible Pokémon. A strong wind blows away the target's barriers such as Reflect or Light Screen. This also lowers the target's evasiveness.

items.Name: HM11
items.Description: Teaches Whirlpool to a compatible Pokémon. The user traps the target in a violent swirling whirlpool for four to five turns.

items.Name: Oak's Parcel
items.Description: A parcel to be delivered to PROF. OAK.

items.Name: Secret Key III
items.Description: The key to Cinnabar Island Gym's front door. It is colored red and decorated.

items.Name: Bike Voucher
items.Description: A voucher for obtaining a bicycle from the Bike Shop.

items.Name: Gold Teeth
items.Description: A set of false teeth lost by the Safari Zone's Warden. It makes his smile sparkle.

items.Name: Card Key III
items.Description: A card-type door key used in Silph Co's office.

items.Name: Lift Key
items.Description: An elevator key used in Team Rocket's Hideout.

items.Name: Silph Scope
items.Description: A scope that makes unseeable Pokémon visible. It is made by Silph Co.

items.Name: Town Map III
items.Description: A very convenient map that can be viewed anytime. It even shows your present location.

items.Name: Fame Checker
items.Description: A device that enables you to recall what you've heard and seen about famous people.

items.Name: TM Case
items.Description: A case that holds TMs and HMs. It is attached to the bag's compartment for important items.

items.Name: Berry Pouch
items.Description: A pouch for carrying Berries. It is attached to the Bag's compartment for important items.

items.Name: Teachy TV
items.Description: A television set that is tuned to a program with useful tips for novice Trainers.

items.Name: Tri - Pass
items.Description: A pass for ferries between One, Two, and Three Island. It has a drawing of three islands.

items.Name: Rainbow Pass
items.Description: A pass for ferries between Vermilion and the Sevii Islands. It features a drawing of a rainbow.

items.Name: Tea
items.Description: A hot drink which is good for quenching thirst.

items.Name: Mystic Ticket
items.Description: A ticket required to board the ship to Navel Rock. It glows with a mystic light.

items.Name: Aurora Ticket
items.Description: A ticket required to board the ship to Birth Island. It glows beautifully.

items.Name: Powder Jar
items.Description: A jar for storing Berry Powder made using a Berry Crusher.

items.Name: Ruby
items.Description: An exquisitely beautiful gem that has a red glow. It symbolizes passion.

items.Name: Sapphire
items.Description: An exquisitely beautiful gem that has a blue glow. It symbolizes honesty.

items.Name: Magma Emblem
items.Description: A medal-like item in the same shape as Team Magma's mark

items.Name: Old Sea Map
items.Description: A faded sea chart that shows the way to a certain island.

items.Name: Meteorite
items.Description: A meteorite that fell from space onto Mt. Moon long ago. It is very lumpy and hard.

items.Name: Money+ Hour
items.Description: A special glowing orb, It slightly increases your Pokédollar earning for 1 hour.

items.Name: Money+ Day
items.Description: A special glowing orb, It slightly increases your Pokédollar earning for 1 day.

items.Name: Money+ Week
items.Description: A special glowing orb, It slightly increases your Pokédollar earning for 1 week.

items.Name: Wild Money Hour
items.Description: A special glowing orb, It allows Pokédollar earning from wild battles for 1 hour.

items.Name: Wild Money Day
items.Description: A special glowing orb, It allows Pokédollar earning from wild battles for 1 day.

items.Name: Wild Money Week
items.Description: A special glowing orb, It allows Pokédollar earning from wild battles for 1 week.

items.Name: Shiny+ Hour
items.Description: A special glowing orb, It slightly increases your chance to find a Shiny Pokémon for 1 hour.

items.Name: Shiny+ Day
items.Description: A special glowing orb, It slightly increases your chance to find a Shiny Pokémon for 1 day.

items.Name: Shiny+ Week
items.Description: A special glowing orb, It slightly increases your chance to find a Shiny Pokémon for 1 week.

items.Name: Pokémon Exp+ Hour
items.Description: A special glowing orb, It slightly increases your Pokémon Exp gain for 1 hour.

items.Name: Pokémon Exp+ Day
items.Description: A special glowing orb, It slightly increases your Pokémon Exp gain for 1 day.

items.Name: Pokémon Exp+ Week
items.Description: A special glowing orb, It slightly increases your Pokémon Exp gain for 1 week.

items.Name: Trainer Exp+ Hour
items.Description: A special glowing orb, It slightly increases your Trainer Exp gain for 1 hour.

items.Name: Trainer Exp+ Day
items.Description: A special glowing orb, It slightly increases your Trainer Exp gain for 1 day.

items.Name: Trainer Exp+ Week
items.Description: A special glowing orb, It slightly increases your Trainer Exp gain for 1 week.

items.Name: EV Training+ Hour
items.Description: A special glowing orb, It increases your EV gain for 1 hour.

items.Name: EV Training+ Day
items.Description: A special glowing orb, It increases your EV gain for 1 day.

items.Name: EV Training+ Week
items.Description: A special glowing orb, It increases your EV gain for 1 week.

items.Name: Hidden Ability+ Hour
items.Description: A special glowing orb, It increases your Hidden Ability chance for 1 hour.

items.Name: Hidden Ability+ Day
items.Description: A special glowing orb, It increases your Hidden Ability chance for 1 day.

items.Name: Hidden Ability+ Week
items.Description: A special glowing orb, It increases your Hidden Ability chance for 1 week.

items.Name: Rare+ Hour
items.Description: A special glowing orb, It increases your Rare Pokemon chance for 1 hour.

items.Name: Rare+ Day
items.Description: A special glowing orb, It increases your Rare Pokemon chance for 1 day.

items.Name: Rare+ Week
items.Description: A special glowing orb, It increases your Rare Pokemon chance for 1 week.

items.Name: Axe
items.Description: A wood cutters axe, It allows you to cut trees without having cut taught to a Pokémon.

items.Name: Flashlight
items.Description: A flashlight, It allows you to light up dark places without having Flash taught to a Pokémon.

items.Name: Hammer
items.Description: A large hammer, It allows you to smash rocks without having Rock Smash taught to a Pokémon.

items.Name: Bat
items.Description: A strong bat for hitting stuff!, It allows you to hit trees without having Headbutt taught to a Pokémon.

items.Name: Climbing Boots
items.Description: Climbing Boots, These allow you to climb up rocks without having Rock Climb taught to a Pokémon.

items.Name: Reroll Token
items.Description: This item is the currency required to lock IV's when rerolling IV's on a Pokémon.

items.Name: Gold Box Small
items.Description: This item will give you 100 gold when opened.

items.Name: Gold Box Big
items.Description: This item will give you 1000 gold when opened.

items.Name: TM101
items.Description: Teaches Work Up to a compatible Pokémon. The user is roused, and its Attack and Sp. Atk stats increase.

items.Name: TM102
items.Description: Teaches Telekinesis to a compatible Pokémon. The user makes the target float with its psychic power. The target is easier to hit for three turns.

items.Name: TM103
items.Description: Teaches Ally Switch to a compatible Pokémon. The user teleports using a strange power and switches places with one of its allies.

items.Name: TM104
items.Description: Teaches Pluck to a compatible Pokémon. The user pecks the target. If the target is holding a Berry, the user eats it and gains its effect.

items.Name: TM105
items.Description: Teaches Leech Life to a compatible Pokémon. The user drains the target's blood. The user's HP is restored by half the damage taken by the target.

items.Name: TM106
items.Description: Teaches Brutal Swing to a compatible Pokémon. The user swings its body around violently to inflict damage on everything in its vicinity.

items.Name: TM107
items.Description: Teaches Smart Strike to a compatible Pokémon. The user stabs the target with a sharp horn. This attack never misses.

items.Name: TM108
items.Description: Teaches Aurora Veil to a compatible Pokémon. This move reduces damage from physical and special moves for five turns. This can be used only in a hailstorm.
